alert.note: Alert for Trinity (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 19 at 3:50PM PDT until August 19 at 5:15PM PDT by NWS Eureka
info.description: The National Weather Service in Eureka has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The August Complex burn scar in... Southwestern Trinity County in northwestern California... * Until 515 PM PDT. * At 350 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the August Complex Burn Scar. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will result in the potential for debris flow. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms in and around the August Complex Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flooding of areas in and around the August Complex Burn Scar. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Zenia. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: This is a life threatening situation. Heavy rainfall will cause extensive and severe flash flooding of creeks...streams...and ditches in the August Complex Burn Scar. Severe debris flows can also be anticipated across roads. Roads and driveways may be washed away in places. If you encounter flood waters...climb to safety.
